intro: Rumex losinskajae, commonly known as the Losinskaja sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves with a reddish or purple coloration on the underside. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, and it is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
